explanations.A: You're almost there - you need to take an extra step to measure the red angle.
explanations.B: This question can be looked at in two ways. Firstly, we can measure the angle of the white part (where the marked angle is not), which is 150°, then using the fact that angles around a point add up to 360°, subtract 150° to get 210°. Alternatively, you can measure the part of the marked angle that can be measured using the protractor, 30°, and recognise that the rest of the angle is 180° as it creates a straight line, then you can add 180° and 30° to get 210° in total for the marked angle.
